meanings.definition: Atrazines: plural noun, a group of herbicides used to control weeds in crops
meanings.sent1: Farmers use atrazines to keep their crops free from pesky weeds.
meanings.sent2: The atrazines were effective in preventing weed growth in the cornfield.
meanings.sent3: The atrazines had a party in the field, making sure no weeds were invited!
meanings.sent4: The atrazines acted like vigilant guards, protecting the crops from invading weeds.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the atrazines stood out against the brown soil, a sign of protection.

meanings.definition: Atrazines: verb, to apply atrazine herbicides to a field for weed control
meanings.sent1: Farmers atrazined the entire field to ensure the crops were safe from weeds.
meanings.sent2: It is important to atrazine the fields before the planting season begins.
meanings.sent3: The farmers decided to atrazine the field dance floor to keep the weeds from crashing the party!
meanings.sent4: She atrazined the garden with precision, like an artist painting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The act of atrazining transformed the field into a fortress against weed invasion.
